sn19.15:1.1: “Just now, reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a scorched woman, sooty and sweaty, flying through the air,
sn19.15:1.3: “That woman used to be the king of Kaliṅga’s chief queen.
sn19.15:1.4: She was of jealous nature, and poured a brazier of hot coals over her co-wife. …” …
